text: This diagram outlines three parallel and segregated basal ganglia loops: the body movement, prefrontal, and limbic circuits. Each loop originates in distinct cortical areas, passes sequentially through specific subdivisions of the striatum, pallidum, and thalamus, and projects back to its respective cortical targets, mediating diverse functions including motor control, executive function, and emotion/motivation.
